definitions.definition: Feeling honoured (by something); feeling happy or satisfied about an event or fact ; gratified .
examples: We're proud of having won / to have won.

subdefinitions.definition: That makes one feel proud (of something one did)
examples: That was not the proudest thing I did but I can’t deny it.

definitions.definition: Possessed of a due sense of what one deserves or is worth .
examples: I was too proud to apologise.

definitions.definition: Having too high an opinion of oneself; arrogant , supercilious , prideful .
Generating a sense of pride ; being a cause for pride.
examples: It was a proud day when we finally won the championship.

definitions.definition: standing upwards as in the manner of a proud person; stately or majestic .

examples: After it had healed, the scar tissue stood proud of his flesh.
The weld was still a bit proud of the panel, so she ground it down flush.

definitions.definition: Excited by sexual desire ; specifically of a female animal : in heat .

main_definition: Feeling honoured (by something); feeling happy or satisfied about an event or fact ; gratified .
secondary_definitions: Possessed of a due sense of what one deserves or is worth .
( chiefly biblical ) Having too high an opinion of oneself; arrogant , supercilious , prideful .
Generating a sense of pride ; being a cause for pride.
(Of things) standing upwards as in the manner of a proud person; stately or majestic .
( obsolete ) Excited by sexual desire ; specifically of a female animal : in heat .
